website_summaries.verdict: A great buy if you are looking for something simple to set up in a more modern style of bedroom.
pros: The instructions are simple to follow, and the whole bed can be assembled in around an hour by a single person
cons: Limited protection around the bed might be inadequate for younger children

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, and definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, LOVE. We bought 2 for our girls, and assembly was done in under 4 hours total, and most of it was done alone. These are sturdy, and super cute. I didn't want to buy the over priced curtains for the underneath, so I made my own with a pressure tension rod, and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SMALL ROOMS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a space saver for my 7 year old sons room. I love it and he loves it. The instructions are wrong but it's pretty easy to figure this thing out. With two people we had this up and ready in less than an hour. It's GREAT for small rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Hughes

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 of these just last August 2017 for our 7 & 8 yr old boys, we have not even had them for a year and not only do they squeak at every move my kiddos make all night but they have LITERALLY been falling apart for months. A screw here and there, now they aren't even safe enough for them to sleep on. We've had to take them out of the room for fear of them collapsing and now have to buy new beds. RIDICULOUS! I wish zero stars could be given!
customer_reviews.author: Rhea C

customer_reviews.title: Have to give all 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I assumed this would be a 3/4 star product. I looked for any little thing to be wrong. Could not find a single thing wrong. Every thing was exactly as advertised. It's not an extra heavy bed. That's not what it says. Parts-all parts included Instructions-the kid could understand Ease-less than an hr from pkg to finish Strength-as advertised Kid loves his bed. It's sturdy for him. If I was pressed to the wall to say one bad thing abt this bed would the the ladder rungs are slick. Duh, they're same material as bed, of course they will be slick. Cheap easy fix. We love
customer_reviews.author: ASConner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for organizing and safe sleeping!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bed! This gave us plenty of space to work with in my sons small room. It was high enough to fit things under the bed but not so high his cats couldn't easily sleep with him. I also don't have to worry about him falling like I would with a full size loft bed. The support bars underneath were also close enough that it worked with a foam mattress without needing further support. Easy assembly. Put together with my sister in about one hour. The screws strip easily tho so make sure you're placing things correctly before tightening down all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: NOT a loft - it’s a slightly elevated bed
customer_reviews.text: This is not a “loft” bed and the photo of the height is misleading. The mattress ends up only about 3 ft off the ground. I couldn’t fit one vertical dresser under it and the lateral one has to be all the way forward (which means stuff falls behind it) in order to reach the drawers without bumping your head on the bed frame. I truly don’t understand the high review score because I don’t see how people are finding a practical use for this height. It’s a barely elevated bed - NOT a loft.
customer_reviews.author: DKL

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. It will keep your awake!
customer_reviews.text: Put this together in January over holiday break. The holes on side guard with the ladder didn’t match up, so I was never able connect it correctly. The bed is very unsturdy and wobbles every time my son moves, despite tightening the hardware weekly. The wobbling is incredibly loud and keeps him awake. Most mornings I find him on the couch or floor because the noise of the bed keeps him awake. While it meets the need of being a space saver, the bed is NOT worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Scrogham

customer_reviews.title: Great size and sturdy! Perfect for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year and it’s still standing strong! I love that it is a low bunk bed perfect for toddlers and elementary aged kiddos. The ladder can be a little harsh on the feet but I’ve never heard complaints of my 5 year old. He loves it! It does squeak a lot But all it needed was a tighten of the screw and it was quiet again! I fit a 6” twin mattress inside and it’s perfect height. I was able to put it together with no extra help took about an hour, I would suggest using a small hand drill that has Allen wrench because then you can really tighten everything and secure it!
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: bad instructions and bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions closely but sometimes the next part in sequence would not fit so I had to take things apart again to add next part. One part was defective but when I called to ask for replacement they asked for a lot of documentation: contact information, proof of purchase, copy of product label, photo of product, photo of defective part, photo of normal part, was the package damage. It took like an hour to collect, photo, attached and email all this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: E Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This bed is awful. The screws are so flimsy that we immediately stripped some. Another one snapped off inside a piece of the frame, rendering that piece useless and the bed impossible to assemble. We contacted the company for replacements of that frame piece and the screws. They only sent us screws. I can’t return the bed to amazon for a refund because I can’t package it back up and mail the damn thing. I’m not sure what other recourse I have except to share an account of my experience with this product. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Morey

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo my son needed some more space in his room so this beef was the solution to that problem. Got the bed and started to assemble. I couldn't find the directions so I thought well hey I got this! As im putting in the hook things to keep the bars in place for the mattress or platform rather, I find the directions 😐 So needless to say, it's easy to assemble!!! I was able to put a 9 cube shelf under there and his Lego table and chairs which cleared up some room and he loves being up so high!
customer_reviews.author: N&A

customer_reviews.title: My girls love them
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together by myself. Not as tall as a normal bunk bed which is perfect. Loads of play room under the beds. So I purchased curtains to create a playhouse for each of my girls. Freed up a lot of space for play time which is just what was needed since my girls share a bedroom. Very pleased customers. Big hint for assembly: only screw bolts in half way until every piece is together, then tighten all bolts. It took me a little less than an hour to assemble and tighten everything per bed and then about 5 minutes to hang lights and curtains, 5 minutes to decorate each and viola perfect play zone
customer_reviews.author: asmith

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together and impossible to move
customer_reviews.text: This bed would've been so perfect if they had just used regular Phillips screws!!!! It is entirely connected using hex screws which made the putting together take forever. Then a year later we had to move so we tried to take it apart...all the screws stripped!!! Now we have a bed we can't put back together after only a year! :(
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, perfect height
customer_reviews.text: My 8yo daughter LOVE it. And now my 10YO son want one as well. It's sturdy. My son and I put it together. Just relax and enjoy the process. TONS of pieces. Enough room for me (5/5") to sit underneath and hang out. I studied under there last night while she slept next to me. Still have to put together the bookshelf for under the bed to hold her toys.
customer_reviews.author: Trudie@UNIS

customer_reviews.title: Screws broke after a couple of years.
customer_reviews.text: It was fine for a couple years, but the side rail just fell off. Two of the screws broke. This rail is next to the ladder, so obviously the kids will hold onto it when they're climbing up. We're actually pretty lucky my daughter didn't get hurt. She's only 70 pounds so it's not like she was just putting a lot of weight on it, just normal kid weight. I think the screws were just poor quality. I suggest getting good screws.
customer_reviews.author: dawn smisek

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Took about 2 hours to assemble. Maybe 2.5. Instructions were clear and easy to follow. Even came with extra pieces in case of an accident. The box this thing came in was LONG and heavy. This frame is pretty sturdy for laying on but I doubt I'll trust 3 little monkeys jumping on the bed or even some bouncing. My daughter loves it. She's 5. I can lay on it by myself with no worries and im about 145 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Karr

customer_reviews.title: A lot of work and parts to assemble but this loft bed but it is very sturdy. The ladder steps are a bit uncomfortable but ...
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter loves it! A lot of work and parts to assemble but this loft bed but it is very sturdy. The ladder steps are a bit uncomfortable but they hold up under the weight of an average adult (130-200lbs). I don't like the selections of loft bed curtains, they have been geared toward children. We purchased it to hide stuff in a teen room but we are unable to find basic colors, they appear to be children's tents or play houses. DOREL INDUSTRIES SHOULD MAKE A REVERSABLE CURTAIN IN BASIC COLORS FOR THIS LOFT BED,
customer_reviews.author: DRSW

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed just becareful with the ladder. And rails.
customer_reviews.text: So my son loves his bed. His room is kind of small but with the loft he had more room now to play under his bed. I gave it 4 stars though for a few reasons. 1- the bed rails are very small. He could very easily roll off. Thankfully he made a barrier of pillows and toys and just sleeps on the side closest to the wall. 2- the ladder steps make no sense. The last step is unnecessary 3- going off the ladder steps. There is nothing to help grip while your going down the ladder. Were going to buy step tape to put on it. To help with it some. Other than those this bed is great.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa F

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky!
customer_reviews.text: 1. The bed is very squeaky! Slightest movement, and it will squeak and creek. 2. Lasted 4 months before the top rail broke off. 3. The bed isn’t very sturdy, it slides around a lot on hardwood floor. Overall bad quality. Sad, because this is a great way to save space.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Woolwine

customer_reviews.title: Take your time! Perfect for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting the bed together today. Total time to assemble with two adults with one break was 1.45 hours. Take your time! Like everyone else said, do not tighten the screws all the way until the end. Directions were easy to follow. After assembling the ends, the rest was easy! Using a 6 inch mattress, there was plenty of room left. Yes, the sticker at the end of the bed is huge, but my daughter doesn't notice. Great alternative to a traditional bunk bed!
customer_reviews.author: Sky Honey B

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the purchase and feel it will last my ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old daughter who has a fairly small room. She LOVES it! We were able to fit her dresser underneath the bed and she still has plenty of room to play underneath. Directions were clear and accurate. I did come across one piece (H) that was drilled wrong at the factory. This was literally the second to last piece to be assembled, so I measured and drilled the hole where it should have been. It wasn't worth disassembling the item or even contacting the manufacturer to get a replacement piece sent. All in all, I am pleased with the purchase and feel it will last my daughter for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: nmill005

customer_reviews.title: Space Saving, works well for ceiling fan and fits 9 cube shelf
customer_reviews.text: Great space saver! Decided on Junior Loft due to ceiling fan. The 9 cube shelf fits perfect underneath and allows for neat reading area. Arrived on time and took us about an hour to assemble. Extra hardware included. My 8 year old loves it and it feels sturdy enough for her for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: AMM89

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 11 year old. Came as expected, was not damaged, all parts and instructions were there and very simple to follow. Put it together by myself in 45 minutes, including making the bed. I did use a drill to VERY GENTLY apply and tighten screws rather than by hand. Just be sure you do not over tighten or u can probably strip the threaded inserts . I am thinking after she uses it a few times that it may need tightening and if the screws loosen regularly they may get some gorilla glue on them. Very happy with it and would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Lady

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Affordable! Easy DIY!! FUN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 5 year old boy and does he love it!!!! Just makes going to bed more fun and hanging out so cool under there like a little clubhouse. The Bed is very sturdy and well built. I’m 180lbs and I can get on top just fine and it doesn’t feel like it’s going to break. Obviously no jumping on the bed but still very sturdy. This took about 45 minutes to build between the wife and I, instructions are fool proof and they send a ton of extra hardware so that’s awesome. Overall very satisfied with the bed and will get another for my daughter when she’s ready for a twin.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I only just put this together today, but my daughter seems to love is so far. It took a couple of hours to put together, but I was able to do it alone. I'm a 5 ft tall woman, for reference. As some other reviewers said, DO NOT tighten the screws until it's together. The rungs on the ladder do hurt a little, so I took another reviewer's suggestion and ordered some pipe insulation to put around it for cushion. I was able to put a couple if bookcases in the bottom, each one is 31.5 inches tall. Overall, a great buy. My kid loves her bed, and especially her little hideout on the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy assembly
customer_reviews.text: The instruction book was very clear & helpful. Easy assembly, I had help but could have done it on my own if necessary. Packaging was not cumbersome or difficult & all the parts were clearly labeled. One of the best assembly-required experiences I have had in a long time. Materials feel sturdy, especially the small hardware (i.e. screws, bolts etc). I know I am not the ideal user as an adult female (5'1, ~145lbs), but it squeaks now when I move - I will have to tighten everything up but it did not start doing that until several months after assembly. Overall would buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Trollinger

customer_reviews.title: Low weight limit
customer_reviews.text: This loft bed is so cute in our daughter’s room. I assembled it myself with help from toddlers in less than an hour. I don’t like that it has a 200lb weight limit. That means my husband can’t get on it and we can’t use it as a guest bed for adults. It’s a little bit rickety so I do wish it was sturdier. It’s a fantastic value for the price though!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Geer

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy, space saving bed!
customer_reviews.text: We got this bed for my 8 year old's room. We put his bookshelf, bean bag, and some pillows underneath it. We strung up some string lights from the bottom railing and he has a cool little reading nook under his bed. It's still easy to climb up and give him snuggles or read a story, and the bed is sturdy and easy to put together. We didn't have any issues with missing or damaged parts, and one person put it together without much trouble, though in a couple of places two people would have made it easier. Overall the bed is good quality for the price, and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Knoke

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 5 year old.
customer_reviews.text: The price of loft beds can be pretty pricey so we were excited to find a jr loft bed that didnt break the bank. It's perfect for our 5 year old. She can climb up easily and we dont have to worry about a big drop down just incase she falls off. Make sure you get the appropriate thickness for your mattress We got one that is too thick and the railing wont serve its purpose for use. So we had to use a toddler rail to keep her from rolling off. The ladder does hurt your feet, we fixed that by adding pool noodle pieces to each step. Over all satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great loft bed for the price. It looks nice (clean lines, nice finish) and it's study. I bought one for my 7 year old and another for my 10 year old. The frame does have some movement/shaking when the kids launch themselves up the ladder or throw themselves onto the bed, but that's to be expected! Its well built and I don't forsee any structural issues.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wimble

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT experience! Better than expected! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Wow--I was so impressed with everything about this! Arrived in two days. Very well packaged and labeled. Easy to follow instructions. We didn't need any extra tools. It took our family about 90 minutes to put the bed together. Great price. This was the perfect fit and match for our son's new room. He loves it! The new 5x7 rug fits perfectly underneath. Bravo! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: SJ Cox

customer_reviews.title: It’s good and bad.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice bed for the price, but the bolts on the bed after a couple days started loosening by themselves. Putting the bed together was a challenge as the plastic mattress supports kept breaking and the holes on the bed don’t line up on a lot of the different pieces. My daughter still loves it, I’m just not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Coyottem

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so, I am usually really good at putting things together but wow this was not fun. My box came with very unhelpful directions that did not go step by step. Nothing was labeled very well and it took forever to put together. It is a decent bed and my son does enjoy it but we have had to tighten the screws a few times as it starts to squeak and make noise. Concerning that the screws slowly un tighten. I would say it is good for what you pay for it. Most beds like this are a few hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these, one pink and two in black. They all came together and I put them up in a total of about 6 hours. The parts are all packaged well, they even include extra hardware and label them as extra so you don't panic about having leftovers. It was much easier than I thought, one person cannot it together easily, but it goes faster with two people. my husband came home halfway through bed 2 and helped with the slat bars and plastic spacers. They are a perfect height for elementary school aged kids. My daughter has turned her bed into a "house" for her baby dolls.
customer_reviews.author: TheMrs.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this bed
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this bed for our seven-year-old son; he loves it. It provides space underneath that he can play and make forts. My wife added a strip of LED lights for night time play. The bed was pretty easy to set up; it only took her and my son an hour or a little more. I would recommend getting a ratcheting hex driver of some kind over the Allen wrench that they provide, it will just make the process a little nicer and quicker. The ladder rungs are round and a little small; I wish these were flat or at least flat on the tops and a little wider but they work okay.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Old Bear

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build, perfect for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This came well packaged and took me about 90 minutes to assemble. The wrench included was sufficient, although I used my drill to tighten the bolts at the end of the process. My 8-year-old daughter loves it, it looks good and stands up well under her rough play. Will probably look to get my son one of these as well when he gets old enough. . From other reviews: the ladder is a little tough on feet, but she does not linger on it so I have not needed to add pool noodle sections. My only complaint is the large safety sticker on the head of the bed, but I guess lawyers are going to lawyer. Overall an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Schutz

customer_reviews.title: Great kid's bed for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great for my 4 year old. It's not too high off the ground, but high enough that I can fit my daughter's crib underneath to save space when we are ready to move her into the same room. For now there is plenty of space for all his toys. I have had to climb up the ladder to get stuff off his bed and I find the ladder to be uncomfortable on my feet, but that is not a problem for him. I also worry a bit about the possibility of him bending the metal slats when he is being rambunctious, but so far so good. Overall I'm happy with it, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Latimer

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Since our house is a bit on the small side I decided to pick this up for the kiddo and maximize play space. Assembly took me a couple hours, and I didn't really need any help. It might be more difficult for someone with limited reach or hand strength.... And if you haven't put many things together. I was satisfied with the sturdiness, my wife tested it out after getting it together to make sure it was stable up top. It was the perfect place to put the kids Big beanbag and read books underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old who was transitioning from a toddler bed. She loves it! It not super high off the ground and has enough room for her old bed and some of her toys to go underneath. She can also walk under it without hitting her head. I used a 7 inch mattress and she sleeps just fine and doesn’t fall off. I did try the pool noodles on the ladder but she ended up taking them off and said it didn’t hurt her feet. Overall I would definitely recommend. Definitely a space saver and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good bed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 4 year old who put grew his toddler bed. It’s not too tall (50in), but I didn’t want it too tall from fear of him falling. He seems to do well climbing up and down. Bars are a little hard on the feet. It took about an hour to put together with two people. Make sure you follow the directions correctly and you won’t have any trouble like other reviews have stated.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Parental advisory!
customer_reviews.text: Watch out for those thin stair rungs! I realize this is a childs bed, but I have to climb up to tuck my daughter in because I'm not tall enough to reach her. Together we don't exceed the weight limit, so I figured it was fine. I miscalculated the last step and it landed across my foot, rupturing my tendon. When we first got it, I took the advice of other reviews and put padding on it but my daughter took it off. She loves the bed, there's way more space in her room, but OMG worst pain ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I put this together while my husband was at work. It took close to 2 hours. My six year old had to help me hold some pieces until the basic frame work was up and stable. There was one step in the directions that was left out but it’s pretty self explanatory. I had trouble getting one of the screws in and 2 of the bars that hold the mattress but my husband snapped them in easily. It is a good value. Looks nice. My son loves it. He hasn’t slept on it yet because we’re waiting for the mattress delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa g

customer_reviews.title: Good bed, bad factory oversight.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bed so, in the end, the purchase was worth it. However, putting it together was a bit of a nightmare. The instructions were easy to follow and everything was labeled well but many of the pieces didn't fit we had to hammer/cut/solder them into shape. Luckily my partner and I are both set builders and were able to do that, otherwise we would have had to return the bed as it would have been impossible to put together. I would have had a very disappointed child.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Wall

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these loft beds for my boys room and they work well. They are great for a smaller room so as not to lose the storage space underneath. I was able to fit a big toy box, a small kids sofa w/ ottoman and paw partol mighty tower under it. I also used the bottom part of one for my disabled child, I put mattress on floor underneath and its just like a bunk bed only no worries of him falling!! works great and he feels like a big kid sleeping there.
customer_reviews.author: shellshell

customer_reviews.title: Not a easy job to assembly it when the parts you received looks like these
customer_reviews.text: Contacted "customer" support, no replacement. "After reviewing the information, I regret to let you know that the parts are not available in stock at the moment, unfortunately there is no an ETA for the parts. An alternative in order minimize any further delay and inconvenience, is to return the unit back to the retailer should it still be within the retailers return policy. Apologies for the inconvenience this may cause. Best regards Consumer Service Representative Share your experience with DHP !'
customer_reviews.author: ProIT4U

customer_reviews.title: My son loves his bed
customer_reviews.text: When I upgraded my son’s bed from a toddler bed I wanted something with storage underneath. This bed worked out great! The only flaw I found but which was no big deal for me, was that the metal bars for the ladder. They are very thin and I felt it would hurt my son’s small feet, so I bought a pool noodle cut it and placed pieces of it on the bars problem solved. Other than that it’s great. I’ve had this bed for 2 years now, it’s still sturdy even after we moved and I dismantled and reassembled it highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: C. Tagh

customer_reviews.title: Great Junior Loft Bed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a temporary bed for our 2 and 3 year old until we could get a nice wood one. But the kids love it so much and it such great quality we are just going to keep it permanently. We put our three year old on top and put a mattress on bottom for our two year old on bottom. This is perfect height. It’s sturdy and safe. And you can’t beat the price for the quality! Listen to the other reviews though and do not tighten till the end! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exited to be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 4 year old son and is not too sturdy even tho he is little and not to heavy when he goes up the bed moves alot and makes the metal squicks alot idk if is a defect but i wont return because is a pain to take it apart and impossible to put it back on the package and return as is a big item is also missing some parts to lock the parts on bottom of the bed and some came broken
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Very low loft,  very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love it, very sturdy. Put it together myself in under 2 hours. Opening the box was the hard part, it weighs an extremely heavy 65 pounds and is glued shut and the cardboard is so thick, taking everything out of the box took almost an hour. But after that, life was good. The loft part is very low so it's great for a child to sit under and great for me as a parent that I don't have to climb up to the bed to reach my child like you would with a bunk bed.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: but other than that it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: It a little wobbly and for me I feel they should make the ladder feet bars flat just for safety issue with any age kid....so they feel more secure climbing up and down and those round bar hurt your feet that why everyone but pool noodles so their kids feet don't hurt.....but other than that it's a good buy....my child who is three loves this bed and loves climbing up and down and I also made the bed tent area under the bed which she loves as well
customer_reviews.author: alisha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent zero issues with it
customer_reviews.text: This loft is excellent. It was really easy to build and found that the instructions were super easy to follow. I put this together by myself in a couple hours. Had to find some creative ways to balance it at times while I put the frame together but I was expecting to do that. Really pleased with the purchase. Good value for the price. Honestly i think the easy to follow directions made this purchase a good value. I was expecting to bang my head against the wall in frustration. Price was also great.
customer_reviews.author: Dubmon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jr. loft bed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Jr. Loft bed. My 10 year old loves it! He says he’s happy it’s not too high. I got this because his 5 year old sister is famous for wanting to dive off of things and I didn’t want her to do it too high off of the ground. Overall, they love the bed. The directions are a bit backwards like when you are almost done with the loft part. I found myself having to back track a bit to unscrew certain parts with the Allen wrench. But other than that, perfect bed!
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: DHP junior loft bed
customer_reviews.text: This is a good solution if you have a ceiling fan in a smaller room. Because it’s shorter than a bunk bed, you have more head clearance. This bed took about 2 hours for 2 adults to assemble. Directions were easy to follow. Nothing difficult. It has about 36” of clearance underneath. We wrapped the frame in fabric and turned it into a hideout for my child: lights, bookshelf, beanbag chair...She loves it. My only complaint is that there’s a big sticker on the end rail that doesn’t easily come off.
customer_reviews.author: KloT

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, seems sturdy enough, probably won't disassemble well
customer_reviews.text: I had this bed setup in about an hour or two, it seems sturdy enough for a child, but I'm not so sure for an adult-sized person, especially if they aren't careful getting in and out of the bed. I don't think it will disassemble well when it comes time to move it, the bolts and rods are cheap material that seem likely to strip or snap, but for $100, I can't really complain. It's a great space-saver in my small room and will work great for lightweight guests.
customer_reviews.author: rupert reviewdock

customer_reviews.title: Great, almost 3 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 months shy of being 3 years old. I previously had bought a Jeep bed for him, and although he loved jeeps (we own one), the bed failed to entice him to sleep in his own bed. Enter this loft bed, and its a whole different story. He LOVES his loft bed, and this single mommy loves sleeping alone (not getting kicked in the ribs!).
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly U

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good..
customer_reviews.text: We REALLY wanted to get something we considered more durable (wooden). However, it was near impossible to find a wooden junior loft bed that didn’t have the Prop 65 warning. This bed suits our needs as it does not have that warning and fits in our space nicely. We created a little library center underneath and added Christmas lights. Huge hit for our 3 year old who was timid at first but loves having her own big girl bed!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very low
customer_reviews.text: Very low to the ground. Which is both a positive and a negative. Bought for my 6 year old when he was moving into a smaller room, hoping to be able to give him more floor space. I like that it's closer to the ground for safety reasons. For storage reasons, it's not the best option. We have his dresser underneath, but that's all that can fit there. So it did the purpose of more floor space, just not as much as hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but hard assembly
customer_reviews.text: The PROS: very sturdy and great for a small room. My daughter thinks it’s the coolest bed ever. The CONS: my husband is really good with putting together furniture and it took him several hours to put this bed together and included a lot of F-bombs :). He also messed it up a couple times and had to redo some pieces because he said the instructions were not at all clear. Another issue I had was that it was much shorter than I thought. I had envisioned putting a lot of her play set and toys under there, but barely anything would fit besides her little table. Overall though, it is a great bed and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect loft bed for a young child
customer_reviews.text: I think it's important to note this bed isn't as tall as a traditional bunk bed. With that said, it's exactly as advertised! I can't imagine being able to put a dresser underneath unless it's a short one but it works perfectly to slide another bed under it to create an L shape. It's already made my boy's room feel so much bigger! There were some parts that were VERY hard to fit into place and I had to get my husband to use force to get them in. But once in the whole process went very smooth and the instructions were easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great value but it is kind of short.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It took my husband and myself a few hours to put together. The screws strip out pretty easily, but other than that it was all put together with an Alan Wrench easily. It isn’t as high as a normal bunkbed, which will pose a problem putting a desk under it like originally planned. It will still make a nice little reading nook for my boys. Our youngest is sleeping on it, so i’m not too upset about it not being tall. Overall, I am pleased for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Westberry

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter absolutely loves it! Perfect height and able to store things underneath, make sure to only finger tighten the bolts until move everything is assembled so you get everything aligned right, then go back, add some lock tight to the screws and tighten all the way! Was delivered at 7am, finished by 8:15am. The rails on the ladder are really thin and did hurt her feet somewhat, but cut up a pool noodle, cover the ladder rails and you're good to go! Cant say about the longevity and sturdiness over time but for the price and what it is, you really cant go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: jmorgan

customer_reviews.title: super loft bed for a young child
customer_reviews.text: This loft bed is fine for a young person that is not heavy. It is well enough made for a a young person. I wish it was higher. the next metal loft bed was 7 ft. too high for most bedrooms. My grand daughters have to duck down to go under it but they love it because they have a desk under it and a bean bag chair and it is like a little hideaway. I have purchased two of theses and will be purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: ELB

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 6 year old loves this bed. At first, he was scared because it has a slight wobble, which is common with metal frame bunk beds, so it wasnt concerning. Assembly was quick and easy. Instructions were super clear and they even packaged extra screws which was helpful because I lost one during the process lol. The underbed room is roomy compared to other loft beds so thats a plus. It was a great buy and the company was great too!
customer_reviews.author: KyBorugian

customer_reviews.title: Great For My Seven Year Old
customer_reviews.text: My seven year old son was so happy to get a bunk bed. He was quick to figure out how to climb up and down, and it's obvious he has had the best sleeps in years up there. It's at a comfortable height that makes me feel like he's safe, but plenty of room underneath for him to play clubhouse. Very pleased with this purchase. My wife and I took a little over an hour putting it together, but it wasn't too complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitri

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Once put together is perfect for a small space and low ceilings. There are about 500 small pieces before it is all said and done so patience and about 4 to 5 hours for build out. I would refrain from doing more than a finger tight turn with the bolts until frame is complete or you will likely ending up backing off all of the bolts as you move to the next piece. Once together is good and sturdy. Deducted one star because the ladder is made with the thin pipe that my grandson complains it too painful to climb and had to made a different step for him
customer_reviews.author: Draco

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS BED! Bought this bed for my boys. My youngest is in a toddler bed and we're not ready to put him in a big bad because he is a wile sleeper. This bed was perfect size. It's super short so I don't have to worry about my 2 year old getting on the top bunk, and it's perfect size to slide the toddler bed right under. Once he gets older, we can replace the toddler bed with a mattress and make it like the bunk beds that sit on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Devin Anglemyer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my tween and teen boys for when they stay at grandma's. I didn't want a bunk bed because thought it would be too hard to assemble. I was worried this would be too small and flimsy for them but it's perfect. The 11 yr old sleeps on top and the 13 yr old on bottom where I put his twin mattress. Works like a ground bunk bed. And i love that I can access the sheets for cleaning on the top bunk easily. Excellent price also. Very appealing.
customer_reviews.author: Hannan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great size!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read instructions/pictures. Came with extra plastic pieces which was good since I broke a few it also came with a Allen wrench thats the only tool you will need. Highly recommend 2 people to put it together. Not sure how I would do it alone. Its a great height for my 5yr old, he loves it! Only thing he complained about was the ladder bars hurt his feet. We plan to put some type of softness to help that. Its a huge space saver in our small apartment and has made more room than I thought!
customer_reviews.author: Shayla Kucera

customer_reviews.title: Junior Loft bed
customer_reviews.text: We bought one for our daughter and one for our son. It took about an hour to assemble each. We wanted them to have reading nooks under the beds. The bar that runs along the back was uncomfortable to lay back on so I cut a pool noodle and slipped it over as a cushion. Our daughter said the Ladder steps kind of hurt her feet so we may have to fine a cushion for them. We’re very happy with these bed though and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Edington-Little

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to put together. Just wait until the end to tighten screws so it all fits together. Kiddo adores his new bed. Mom adores the freed up floor space! He didn’t want something really tall and this ended up being the perfect height. Ugly sticker that they want you to keep on could be smaller, but pillows cover it. The ladder bars immediately hurt his feet. Thanks to the reviews I had a pool noodle and some duct tape ready to make a “rope ladder.” So comfy he likes to sit on it now. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: The frame although not as sturdy as I would have hoped is easy to put together, just a few screws here and there. The only con I can think of is there isn't a size listed anywhere, not on the box not on the listing anywhere. I had to go by the reviews to get the info I needed. Thankfully they were right. Over all my son loves it, that's all that really matters. P.S. BUY A TWIN MATTRESS!
customer_reviews.author: anarchysk8

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I put this together by myself, it took about an hour and a half. The instructions were very clear, just don't tighten anything all the way until you're done putting all the pieces together. The bed is sturdy enough... It's metal so if course it creaks and shakes a little. The ladder rungs hurt our feet, so I did the old trick with the pool noodles and tape. Use pretty tape though, so it'll still look cool. I strung safe indoor lights around the bottom, and it is the perfect little hide out for my daughter. We love this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first it didn't look strong enough, but once received it and took 3 trial and errors hehe.. my lil one slept soundly the first day. I put my twin mattress under and we both had a very well night's rest. The metal from under her bed doesn't feel sturdy enough bends quite a tiny bit so I remind my lil one NOT to be jumping for her safety. Still worth the purchase being a single parent in a small single.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed
customer_reviews.text: We got this bed for my 6 yo son who is autistic and loves to hide in places. We initially thought a higher bed would be too much for him sensory wise but once we got it together and realized it doesnt sit that high up It made us and him more comfortable. it is about 4 ft off the grouund which ended up making plenty of room in bedroom to hide things, we even could fit his dresser under it. Its a very sturdy and well made piece. We were pleased with the price point and the overall feel of the bed. It was a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The holes are not where they are supposed to be. I thought I was building it wrong at first but there is no other way to do it. I had to drill my own holes on a few pieces. It can never be disassembled and rebuilt now. It was cheap and exactly what I needed to place two beds in a small room. If the company would have assembled the parts correctly it would not be such a bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J-Utah

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The bed was good when installed and was really cool for my son. He loves it so I am keeping it, but after several months the screws are all coming loose and the bed is all loose. There are missing screws as I can seem to find some after they fell from the bed. If you don't mind inspecting it like every couple of weeks and tighten loose screws this it the bed for you. If you are like me and have better things to do with your time, don't buy this bed. I would throw out this piece of junk if my son would let me.
customer_reviews.author: BTC

customer_reviews.title: Used as a bunkbed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make more space in the kids room. Room enough underneath for a toddler bed(and still have enough room to sit up in bed) and also space to keep the toys under. Pretty sturdy, especially if up against a wall. Super easy assembly, with 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cute & Space saver too
customer_reviews.text: This loft bed is perfect for small rooms because you can use the bottom for storage. If you buy make sure you’re aware that the twin mattress should be 8 inches thick or less because the built in side rails won’t serve as protection. I’m planning on adding bed bumpers or add our old bed rail to be on the safer side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute bed!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took a little bit of time but made sense. My 4 yo loves it. Plenty of space underneath I can fit his cube storage and his toy storage shelf underneath and he still has room to play. The ladder is hard on feet because the bars are so small. My son has never complained, but I climb up there and lay with him most nights and it hurts my feet so I just cut a pool noodle and put it over the ladder rails. We love it very sturdy and clean looking.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful low loft!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful low loft! My kiddo is a climber through and through and so far LOVES this bed. She’ll be 2 in a couple weeks and I love that it’s low enough to the ground that if she falls(only happened once when she was jumping and she learned her lesson)she won’t be maimed. Thanks so much for a quality product at a low price. A word of advice, just barely tighten the bolts as you’re putting it together; then tighten everything at the end. Otherwise you’ll be loosening pieces to fit others in!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Ermoian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height, easy installation & good quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: First of i love how the shipping is fast, i live in Hawaii & normally thing like this takes a while to get to where i live. The product is very durable & well made, very fast & easy to follow the instructions. So far my 9yo daughter loves this & its a perfect height, i have a 9months old baby & thinking of putting a bed on the bottom or it can also be a hang out place for my older daughter. Im well satisfied with this purchase;-)
customer_reviews.author: Lixzel Ramelb

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: This bed is pretty awesome! And the price can’t be beat! It took me 3 long hours to assemble it by myself because I got to the end and had to start over bc I put the first piece on the wrong end so READ THE INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY unlike me. Also, do not tighten bolts unless it tells you to bc you will run into some issues later down the road. Like many others, we put pool noodles on the stairs to help with comfort. All in all, we love this bed and you should buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great bed, great price
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I'm not giving this bed the full 5 stars is because we had to modify the ladder. I knew based on reviews I read the ladder may hurt feet though. I just bought cheap hand towels and duck taped them around the rings. The build took my husband about two hours. Word to the wise, don't tighten your screws all the way untill the end. My son absolutely loves his new bed. It feels sturdy and is plenty roomie! Great purchase! Super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Vanflower

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim during a chaotic, unexpected move. I honestly, didn't think it would be the greatest - I was, however, wrong. This is a great loft bed. Wasn't super hard to put together (took about an hour). Has great storage space underneath. Loving the way I can create more space in my daughters bedroom. Holds as sturdy as expected. My daughter is roughly 140 lbs and has had no issues. I would recommend; great pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bed. I got it because I was able to put another twin mattress underneath for my old dog to be comfy while also freeing up floor for her to play. It's a great bed and it's not very high. I am only 5'4 and can still gives her bed time hugs and kisses and tuck her in when putting her to bed. She loves that it's off the floor but not high. The ladder I did have to use pool noodles and colored ducktape to make it squishier. Honestly though she could have dealt with it though and still been very happy. She is 7 and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This bunk bed was exactly what we hoped for. Our 6yr old is active and we didn't want a bunk bed that was too high - this one is perfect. We purchased a bean bag and a small book shelf so it's his 'chill' space. It was REALLY easy to put together but you need 2 people AND make sure you have a socket set with allen heads (in lieu of the allen wrench it comes with).
customer_reviews.author: C D

customer_reviews.title: Great bed, Great price
customer_reviews.text: These were super easy to put together, I had both my kids help with their own bed. Ones 12 the other 16. They absolutely love their new beds and even though they are the shorter loft they still made there own space underneath. One with blow up chair small bookcase and lamp with her stuffed animals the other with a tv. Playstation and comfy blankets. They add so much room to the space. So worth it and you cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: kfairy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these for our kids (age 4 and 5). Boxes arrived in good condition, instructions were easy to follow, and assembly was quick (two of us assembled both beds in about an hour). Definitely recommend using a hex tool bit on a screwdriver or ratchet as it would have taken forever using the included allen wrench. Our girls love them. Under bed height is about 3 ft., enough for them to enjoy as an extra play area that would otherwise be unusable with a regular bed. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, great height & Spacious
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter has the loft bed in her room, she loves it! She's able to store whatever she wants under the bed to make up for space she has a small table, small chair, a toy box & 3 plastic drawer shelves for her school stuff, crafts, hair and makeup. The only cons would be all of the bar's that attach to the middle frame caused longer assembly and extra help but the bed was well worth buying. Make sure to purchase the right size bed mattress to fit the bed and you can also ad a curtain around the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Damaged, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Let's start at the beginning. It's an insane pain just to get all of the parts out of the box. Good luck with that fight. Several pieces (I bought 2 of these) were damaged and scratched. I had to grab a hammer and bang out part of the piece so they'd fit. The warning sticker is so ugly and huge. The ladder is so painful to actually use, my kids basically want to just jump. This was a cheap purchase so just know what tho expect.
customer_reviews.author: Frankii

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this purchase. It took two of us about 2 hours to assemble. All parts were in packaging with excellent instructions. Granddaughter loves sleeping in it and is perfect size for 6 year old, not too high off floor, making small bedroom have extra playing space. I (grandma) can get in it easily to make bed. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: countrygal

customer_reviews.title: Bed is great, missing safety part
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say this bed is great. Easy enough for one to put together, but 2 is probably better. Feels good and sturdy. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because it is missing a part. I know what your saying, one whole star for a part? Well, it's a pretty important safety part: one of the endcaps for the ladder to the second level of the bed. I know I can trek up to the hardware store and find something to go in there, but I shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Good bed
customer_reviews.text: Went together easily enough and seems sturdy enough. I do recommend a little loctite superglue, a very small drop once the bolts are in, back them out a quarter inch and apply then re-tighten. Otherwise, check periodically for loose bolts and snug them back up. The loft isn't as high as a traditional top bunk so don't expect to use the space underneath for much. It works ok to store toy boxes or small dressers, that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon the Hobbiest

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, sturdy yet lightweight. Works great for small spaces! Its the perfect height, its high enough to be able to create a play space below but yet not too high to be scary. My daughter is afraid of heights so I was very worried but she ended up loving her bed! Her favorite part is the conveinent little opening for her to climb down.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Mabe

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great specs... But...
customer_reviews.text: As much as this bed is loved by a little one, it has issues. One frame leg arrived dented/bent. Looks like a factory defect, because it seems it was painted after it was damaged. Reviews said it was sturdy, but it is quite wobbly. Be careful when assembling, the screws are very easily stripped. I don't think it can take more than one disassemble and reassemble. Good price but I got what I paid for, would be surprised if it lasts more than 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Coco Loco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Loft bunkbed
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness. The lift arrived yesterday. My husband put it together in less than an hour with no fuss or complications. My whole family LOVES it and the way it's allowed us to set up the girls room. Thank you so very very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for a little one!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble. Alot of pieces but juts follow instructions and your good. It's for my 4year pld, so the height under it and perfect to play under. Only complaint is the ladder rungs hurt his feet.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE these beds!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a blue one for my son through walmart and loved it so much that I bought a pink one for my daughter. These beds are so cute! I used pool noodles and duct tape on the ladders. I def recommend ordering through Amazon verses walmart. The Amazon bed was here in 2 or 3 days and I waited 2 weeks on the walmart bed. I bought zinus slumber 1 mattresses through walmart for these beds and they are perfect. If you need a cheap mattress that is good quality, the slumber 1 is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 love this bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed is excellent for a children’s room. I bought one for my daughter, and loved it so much I bought a second for my son. Makes so much space available in their rooms. Also an excellent value for the money. Took 2 ppl about 2 hours per bed The only con about this bed is that it’s kind of a pain to make
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: JUNIOR Loft: Easy to put together, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for one of our kiddos who recently turned 5. It’s the perfect height & it’s sturdy. It took us approx 75 minutes to build it. One pole was dented, but not chipped, so no issue. We used pool noodle pieces on the ladder, as suggested by other reviews. We also used a wood plank under the mattress for support. You do have plastic support pieces that line up down the center of the bed, but the wood is sturdier. The frame is easy to assemble & most pieces are letter labeled (think IKEA). Overall, it’s a great purchase & enables us to use the entire floor space now. All of our kids want one now!
customer_reviews.author: Momma2*3
